#libraries
```{r libs}
library(tidyverse)
```


sadly the vectrino data files are too big to fit on github. I'll therefore be bad (unreproducible) and use setwd() as a temporary workaround

#load in the big vectrino file
```{r load in the big vectrino file}
setwd("C:/Users/!j.wingenroth")
raw<-readLines("downloads/experiment_20180920.263.18.Vectrino Profiler.00000.dat")
```

#extract x lines
```{r extract values}
x_vals<-as_tibble(grep("^Profiles_Velocity_X", raw, value = TRUE))
```

#get tidy data from x lines
```{r}
x1 <- x_vals$value %>%
  str_match("\\[\\s-*\\d\\.\\d+") %>%
  str_sub(3)

#x2 and x3 should be accessible with regex formulas too, but I'm out of time for now
```

time data should be incorporated also! However, as I'm short on time:

```{r}

x1 %>%
  as.numeric() %>%
  mean(na.rm = TRUE)

plot(x1[20000:length(x1)], col = alpha("black", 0.1))

```
